item.title: Timnit Gebru (she/her)
item.description:
Andreessen may have blocked me on twitter but it seems he sees eye to eye with all of us at DAIR! Cause we write:"If corporations are not allowed to exploit labor...they will not be able to proliferate harmful technologies as quickly ‚Äî their market calculations would simply dissuade them from doing so."
https://www.noemamag.com/the-exploited-labor-behind-artificial-intelligence/

item.title: Erick Ratamero
item.description: losing my mind at people in science jamming LLMs into EVERYTHING without a single thought about all the extremely valid concerns people have raised about them again and again

item.title: Redish Lab
item.description: Looking forward to #sfn23 next week!We've got four posters, scattered across the days.1. Saturday PM VV (double V) 20: Clarifying proactive and reactive cognitive control deficits in psychosis via drift diffusion modeling2. Sunday PM NN 12: Probing the role of prefrontal cortex, hippocampus, and dorsolateral striatum on decision-making in complex spatial environments3. Sunday PM OO6: Hippocampal Representations in rats worried about being attacked by a threatening robot in the ‚Äúrobogator‚Äù approach-avoidance task4. Tuesday PM TT9 Network physiology metrics reveal a dynamic balance between excitatory and inhibitory functional connections in rodent prefrontal cortex during decision making Come check 'em out!I love #SFN. It's my favorite meeting. I'm looking forward to seeing both old and new friends on the poster floor!

item.title: Dr. jonny phd
item.description: whoopeldy boopeldy #SfN23 poster is done, now to sleep. neuromatchstodon right up there nestled next to the title <3

item.title: Tim Verstynen
item.description:
Folk going to #sfn23, check out my amazing student Kim Nestor‚Äôs poster. ‚ÄúOpposing engagement of cerebellar and basal ganglia networks with shifts of cortical network topology‚ÄùSession Title: Effects of Executive Functions on Learning and Memory
Session Time: 11/14/2023 8:00:00 AM - 11/14/2023 12:00:00 PM
Presentation Time: Tue. Nov. 14, 2023 9:00 AM - 10:00 AM
Posterboard Number: VV9

item.title: Michele Banks
item.description: Going to #SfN #SfN23? Don't miss the #sciart booths! https://open.substack.com/pub/artologica/p/brainy-days #neuroscience

item.title: The Viking
item.description:
For those of you going to #sfn23 consider visiting my students' (Kaitlyn and Emils) poster:Sensorimotor control with biophysically-based thalamocortical spiking network model
K. J. HOESTEREY, *E. M. MATISS, M. L. LAPORTE, D. I. STANDAGE, G. BLOHMTue. Nov. 14, 2023 9:00 AM - 10:00 AM, PSTR349.15, board FF24

item.title: ProjectFearlessness
item.description:
"The minister is absolutely right when he says there is no place for hate on our streets. Isn‚Äôt the truth of the matter though there is no place for hate in the Home Office either, and the problem with the present home secretary is that she‚Äôs the person inciting hatred in this country."Chris Bryant,
Labour MP,
House of Commons,
U.K.#UKPolitics
#RemembranceSunday

item.title: Prof Christina Pagel
item.description: Too many think that, in the end, NHS coped fine with covid I'm planning a substack on what happened from 2020-21, inc ICU I'd like to include ANONYMOUS quotes from FRONTLINE staff on what it was like, to bear witness Please fill out & share! surveymonkey.co.uk/r/PKH9MRT

item.title: tomstafford
item.description: Thoughts from David Glanzman (UCLA) on high-risk research https://goodscience.substack.com/p/thoughts-from-david-glanzman-ucla Stuart Buck tells a sobering anecdote about a neuroscience professor whose research funding dried up when he wanted to pursue a paradigm-challenging result"whenever you apply to a funding agency, they always say ‚Äúwe want creative, outside-the-box-thinking.‚Äù...But what I learned is in fact...If you go outside-the-box, they‚Äôre going to run the other way screaming."#metaresearch #neuroscience

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Looking forward to joining the SciFri Book Club to talk about some of the fabulous writers featured in this year's Best American Science and Nature Writing! Register here: https://secure.everyaction.com/WsjyL4tn60OrqMom1hKV2Q2

item.title: PCI RR
item.description: REMINDER: Every year we close @pcirr during December to accommodate reviewer and recommender holiday schedules.This year, PCI RR will be closed to ALL submissions from 1st December 2023 until 10th January 2024. During this time reviewers will remain able to submit reviews, and recommenders can issue decision letters for ongoing submissions, but no new or revised submissions can be made by authors.

item.title: just adrienne
item.description: The Jewish students at Brown who were arrested last night (for a pro-Palestinian protest) have released a very powerful statement."We know intimately that Jewish struggles are necessarily bound up in global struggles for freedom. We are a group of Jewish students who have coalesced around our shared vision of justice, anti-occupation, liberation and community. We ask you to listen to us now:"https://www.browndailyherald.com/article/2023/11/an-open-letter-from-jewish-students

item.title: International Brain Laboratory
item.description: Click through to add these to your SfN program:Brain-wide atlas of Electrophysiological properties and associated tools: https://www.abstractsonline.com/pp8/#!/10892/presentation/39428Atlas of intrinsic timescales in the mousebrain: https://www.abstractsonline.com/pp8/#!/10892/presentation/41757Automating multi-probe insertions to improve the efficiency and reproducibility of electrophysiology experiments: https://www.abstractsonline.com/pp8/#!/10892/presentation/37750Universal Renderer for Neuroscience: https://www.abstractsonline.com/pp8/#!/10892/presentation/37766Lightning Pose: https://www.abstractsonline.com/pp8/#!/10892/presentation/37745
